channel.title: ASF JIRA
channel.description: This file is an XML representation of an issue

item.title: [HBASE-9505] Enable replication by default
item.description: Wondering if we can enable replication by default, going to attach a patch that does it and get a QA run.

status.description: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are closed can be reopened.

comments.comment:
JD,

I am talking within my company to turn on replication by default. This jira will help to make my case. Wondering whether we can also enable it on 0.94 by default? thanks.

Demai

-1 overall. Here are the results of testing the latest attachment
http://issues.apache.org/jira/secure/attachment/12602632/HBASE-9505.patch
against trunk revision .

+1 @author. The patch does not contain any @author tags.

-1 tests included. The patch doesn't appear to include any new or modified tests.
Please justify why no new tests are needed for this patch.
Also please list what manual steps were performed to verify this patch.

+1 hadoop1.0. The patch compiles against the hadoop 1.0 profile.

+1 hadoop2.0. The patch compiles against the hadoop 2.0 profile.

+1 javadoc. The javadoc tool did not generate any warning messages.

+1 javac. The applied patch does not increase the total number of javac compiler warnings.

+1 findbugs. The patch does not introduce any new Findbugs (version 1.3.9) warnings.

+1 release audit. The applied patch does not increase the total number of release audit warnings.

+1 lineLengths. The patch does not introduce lines longer than 100

+1 site. The mvn site goal succeeds with this patch.

This message is automatically generated.
Heh, looks like we have a few NPEs to fix before this happens.
In the first patch I missed setting one place to true.

Demai Ni it would take some testing, like here where I'm making sure that all the tests pass. Then make sure it won't affect performance or introduce new bugs for those who don't use replication. Hopefully while doing this for 0.96.0 we can cover most of 0.94 but the code has changed a lot.

You'd also have to convince/bribe Lars Hofhansl.
Jean-Daniel Cryans,bribery is my best development tool for sure. haha. btw, off topic, I finally got some time back on hbase-9047, I will upload a trunk patch in a day or two.

-1 overall. Here are the results of testing the latest attachment
http://issues.apache.org/jira/secure/attachment/12602712/HBASE-9505-v2.patch
against trunk revision .

+1 @author. The patch does not contain any @author tags.

-1 tests included. The patch doesn't appear to include any new or modified tests.
Please justify why no new tests are needed for this patch.
Also please list what manual steps were performed to verify this patch.

+1 hadoop1.0. The patch compiles against the hadoop 1.0 profile.

+1 hadoop2.0. The patch compiles against the hadoop 2.0 profile.

+1 javadoc. The javadoc tool did not generate any warning messages.

+1 javac. The applied patch does not increase the total number of javac compiler warnings.

+1 findbugs. The patch does not introduce any new Findbugs (version 1.3.9) warnings.

+1 release audit. The applied patch does not increase the total number of release audit warnings.

+1 lineLengths. The patch does not introduce lines longer than 100

-1 core tests. The patch failed these unit tests:
org.apache.hadoop.hbase.master.TestDistributedLogSplitting

This message is automatically generated.
Seems better to leave it off by default in 0.94 following the principle of the least surprise. It's just how we default the config option, no other changes.

Lars Hofhanslunderstood. Once JD's patch works on trunk. that is no functional or performance concerns. I will try to convince my team to set the default through hbase-site.xml instead of hbase code during installation time.

patch v2 fixed most of the issues but TestDistributedLogSplitting was failing because it was passing an incorrect HTD to append. This patch adds a check against this in Replication and fixes the HTD in the test.

Reviewing patch v3:

-    if (!conf.getBoolean(HConstants.REPLICATION_ENABLE_KEY, false)) {

+    if (!conf.getBoolean(HConstants.REPLICATION_ENABLE_KEY, true)) {

You check this 3 times. Might as well promote the default value to HConstants.

-      if (kv.matchingFamily(WALEdit.METAFAMILY)) continue;

+      // unit tests have a tendency to pass incorrect htds, prevent NPEs by checking if null

+      if (kv.matchingFamily(WALEdit.METAFAMILY) || htd.getFamily(family) == null) continue;

I'd prefer to see the tests fixed rather than silently ignoring what otherwise would be a bug.

I'd prefer to see the tests fixed rather than silently ignoring what otherwise would be a bug.

This bit in the patch fixes the test, if that's what you meant?

+    byte[] family = Bytes.toBytes(fname);

+    htd.addFamily(new HColumnDescriptor(family));
Sure. Since that's the only test that depended on the "broken" behavior, I'd prefer to see the htd.getFamily(family) == null check not included.
Patch v4 adds an assert instead of the null check so that it will be more obvious what fails in unit tests in the future. Also I promoted the default value to HConstants.

+1

Thanks for humoring my inner pedant
Retry hadoopqa now device has been cleaned

This issue was closed as part of a bulk closing operation on 2015-11-20. All issues that have been resolved and where all fixVersions have been released have been closed (following discussions on the mailing list).

customfieldvalues.customfieldvalue: hbase.replication is now true by default, meaning that users can add peers without having to do anything special and that any cluster can become a slave as soon as it is running.
